ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: A young group of well qualified personalities mainly from Medical, Accounting & Social sector came together with object to do something for the Nation with words "DEDICATED TO HEALTH OF NATION" and they Consituted a Organization namely "DRUSHTI BAHUUDDESHIYA VIKAS SANSTHA" Organization was therefor Registerd under society Registration Act 1860 and Bombay public Trust ACT 1950 in the year 2002. The Organization is working as NGO. It was in these circumstances "Drushti"NGO,emerged as a potent non- goverment organization for redering its resources for a constructive and progressive utilization to meet the overall objective of just development. It made it formal presence by resistering under societies Registration ACT 1860 M/43/2002 & Under BPT Act 1950 F/8399/02. A group of like-minded commited people formed an association in the year 1998 to bring some meaningful change in the society there by diverting their energies towards developing sensible approaches. This association eventually became the formal organization in the year 2002. The following are the strategies the organization usually follows in executing any activity. 1) peoples participation 2) upward movement of power 3) Involvement of women 4) Concurrent monitoring & evaluations 5) Realistic & Result oriented designs 6) Qualitative & Quantitatively output measurment 7) primary & Secondary data as base 8) Identifying expertise and maintaining good relationship 9) preference on sustainable & replicable models ACTIVITIES OF THE ORGANIZATION 1)CCC- Community care centre funded by GFATM-NACO-KHPT 2)PPTCT Project- Prevention of parent to child transmission of HIV/AIDS activity funded by GFATM-NACO-ILFS 3)Drushti Hospital-Our organization is rinning 10 bedded Hospital recognized by GOVT. authority. 4) Mobile Dispensary for backward and tribal area of Gondia District 5) RCH Project-Reproduction & child health program in Goregaon Taluka District Gondia. 6) DOTS centre- Under RNTPC 7) PC & PNDT Program-Drushti NGO implementing PC & PNDT and Sex ratio awareness program under NRHM Gondia 8) Drushti Sports Health and fitness club` 9) ARSH 10) Pulse-Polio Abhiyan

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Sustainable Sanitation and Water management trainings (menstrual hygiene trainings, mason trainings, school sanitation trainings etc.)

To motivate entrepreneurs and create small medium enterprises in the sector of ecological sanitation. 3 business concepts have been identified 1)Ecosan Toilets 2)Toilet and 3)Septage management Services. The projects aim to extend support to the flagship national program Swachh Bharat Mission and state program Swachh Maharashtra Abhiyan. The ent created will provide services to last denominator of the society and reach the remote places to the bridge the gap of access to sanitation

Natural Water Systems and Treatment Technologies cope up with water shortages in urbanised India – is an India- EU research project, supported by Department of Science and Technology under European Commission’s 7th Framework Programme. The project aims to deploy a holistic approach to minimize the urban water footprint and enhance the water security of the area by closing watercycle.

providing Urine Diversion Dry Toilets(UDDTs) to households of a hamlet named Darewadi in Garade village, located off Khed-Shivapur road, about 32km south of Pune since the village was witness to rampant open defecation and water scarcity among other issues. The UDDT’s are excellent models of environmental sustainability, using minimum water and provides options for reuse of faeces and urine as fertilizers for the farms.

ngoList.title: Forest Regeneration And Environmental Sustainability Trust
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Major Ongoing Projects- 1. FORREST instigated ecological assessment of Mayurashwar Wildlife Sanctuary on a seasonal basis, in collaboration with Maharashra Forest Department,Wildlife Wing, in Jan 2016. This one of the kind field study focuses on assessment of current floral and faunal biodiversity of the sanctuary so as to develop a better conservation plan keeping in view the various environmental and social dynamics of the area. 2. FORREST is working to develop a conservation management plan for Bhamburda Van Vihar, Pune in collaboration with Maharashra Forest Department, R n D wing. 3. FORREST is conducting an ecological assessment comprising of season-wise occurrences and distribution of flora and fauna to develop a conservation management plan of a private area in Kamshet, Pune, Maharashtra. 4. FORREST has undertaken social forestry initiative is Kirti Garden tekri on Sus village road, Pune, in collaboration with the Garden Department of Pune Municipal Corporation. 5. FORREST has completed water audit for Kool Homes Residential Apartment to assess and understand the water inflow, outflow and consumption of water pattern within the society so as to develop measures to bring efficiency in water consumption of the society. 6. FORREST has undertaken Green Audit of R.L.Law College, Belagavi , Karnataka. 7. FORREST has undertaken Green Audit of Ajeenkya D. Y. Patil University, Pune. 8. FORREST is publishing a book on Green Waste Composting.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: FRIENDS FOUNDATION is an organization registered under the Religious, Social, Educational and Charitable Society act in the state of Maharashtra since 2013. The society works for the upliftment of the underprivileged in the society. All the programme of the society are located in some of the most backward and needy areas of Maharashtra. One of the focus areas of the society is Child Development. Apart from various other activities, the society runs one orphanage and one School. As on date 15 children are being benefitted through the activities of the society. The children are chosen based on the level of poverty irrespective of their caste, creed or religion. All the 15 children are provided various inputs in the areas of cognitive, physical and socio emotional development. The orphanage and the School are located in Nandurbar, districts of Maharashtra.The district is home to some of the underdeveloped communities in Maharashtra. The people here belong to the tribal groups of Bhil,Kokini,Pawara, Mavchi, Varli, gamit and Ahir. Apart from them, there are people who have migrated from Nandurbar, and have been living here for several generations. and access to various services and facilities for the betterment of the community is an issue. 95% of the parents of the children work as Daily laborers in farmer estate. Their work completely depends on seasonal rains. Failure of seasonal rains would lead to starvation as people would not be able to get jobs. In addition to this, people are addicted to alcohol and drugs leading to 32% of the families being broken. Around 45% of the children in this area are malnourished.
